video.title: TEDTalks: Rebel Design
video.synopsis: Rebellious creative designers craft elegant solutions to our most unshakable problems and turn the mundane into the marvelous.

episodes.synopsis: Designer Stefan Sagmeister shares his latest thinking on happiness -- both the conscious and unconscious kind.
episodes.title: Stefan Sagmeister: Seven Rules for Making More Happiness

episodes.synopsis: Artist Aaron Koblin takes vast amounts of data -- and at times vast numbers of people -- to create stunning visualizations.
episodes.title: Aaron Koblin: Artfully Visualizing Our Humanity

episodes.synopsis: It takes an entire civilization to build a toaster. Designer Thomas Thwaites found out the hard way.
episodes.title: Thomas Thwaites: How I Built a Toaster -- From Scratch

episodes.synopsis: David McCandless turns complex data sets into beautiful, simple diagrams that tease out unseen patterns and connections.
episodes.title: David McCandless: The Beauty of Data Visualization

episodes.synopsis: This wearable device was the buzz of TED. Imagine "Minority Report" and then some.
episodes.title: Pattie Maes and Pranav Mistry Demo SixthSense

episodes.synopsis: Can good design save the newspaper? It just might, according to an extraordinary Polish newspaper designer.
episodes.title: Jacek Utko Designs to Save Newspapers

episodes.synopsis: In graphic design, Marian Bantjes says, adding individuality to a project is heresy. But she built a career doing just that.
episodes.title: Marian Bantjes: Intricate Beauty by Design

episodes.synopsis: Designer Yves Behar discusses some of the iconic objects he's created and witty, surprising objects he's working on now.
episodes.title: Yves Behar on Designing Objects That Tell Stories

episodes.synopsis: The "Minority Report" science adviser and inventor demos g-speak -- the real-life version of the film's computer interface.
episodes.title: John Underkoffler Points to the Future of UI

episodes.synopsis: In a demo that drew gasps, Blaise Agüera y Arcas demos new augmented-reality mapping technology from Microsoft.
episodes.title: Blaise Agüera y Arcas Demos Augmented-Reality Maps

episodes.synopsis: A design-build class engages high schoolers while bringing smart design and new opportunities to a poor community.
episodes.title: Emily Pilloton: Teaching Design for Change

episodes.synopsis: A computer graphics trailblazer explains Digital Emily, a digital human face so realistic it stands up to multiple takes.
episodes.title: Paul Debevec Animates a Photo-Real Digital Face

episodes.synopsis: An engineer shares ultra-low-cost design from India that could bring expensive products (cars, prosthetics) to everyone.
episodes.title: R.A. Mashelkar: Breakthrough Designs for Ultra-Low-Cost Products

episodes.synopsis: Tim Brown says the design profession is preoccupied with creating nifty, fashionable objects. He calls for a shift.
episodes.title: Tim Brown Urges Designers to Think Big
